page.title: 11Changing Times 1
page.content: Mrs.Cove has lived at{Townsend Farm since her marriage at the age of 28 years _ some 62 years.It was a{mixed {farm}_{arable}and{stock}and for many years they kept a large stable of shire horses to work the farm. Until the end of{second world war they used a mixture of cart_horses and tractors,before finally going over to tractors in the early fifties. Mrs.Cove said:"They don't farm now,they rush over the land.We used to have a{relationship}with the animals,that doesn't happen any more." Mrs.Cove told us that when men came to work,they came for life.During the war Mrs.Cove had six reliable{German {prisoners}working on the farm,of which one of them stayed to make his life there.Mrs. Cove's regret is that farming is like a factory now.
